item.title: 印度经济增长蹒跚，莫迪支持中产阶级而非失业者
item.description: 印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）在预算中为印度中产阶级大幅减税，以缓解经济在全球逆风中的压力，但对去年投票反对他的数百万失业者却没有提供什么直接支持。【原文：Prime Minister Narendra Modi gave India’s middle classes significant tax relief in his budget to cushion the economy against global headwinds, but provided little direct support to the millions of unemployed who voted against him last year.】

item.title: 特朗普关税针对中国网络零售商利用的漏洞
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统对中国、加拿大和墨西哥的新贸易征税包括对电子商务的大举进攻，显然计划取消对价值低于 800 美元的包裹长期实行的关税豁免。【原文：President Donald Trump’s new trade levies against China, Canada and Mexico include a broadside against e-commerce, with apparent plans to extinguish a long-held tariff exemption for packages worth less than $800.】

item.title: 印尼可能在即将出台的规则中设定社交媒体使用年龄限制
item.description: 印度尼西亚可能会对社交媒体的使用设定年龄限制，作为即将出台的保护儿童免受网上有害内容侵害的法规的一部分。【原文：Indonesia may set an age limit on social media use as part of upcoming regulations to protect children from harmful content online.】

item.title: 中国誓言采取措施反击美国关税，威胁 WTO 行动
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）宣布对来自世界第二大经济体的进口商品征收 10%的关税后，中国政府誓言将对美国采取不明确的 "相应反制措施"。【原文：The Chinese government vowed to take unspecified “corresponding countermeasures” against the US, after President Donald Trump announced a 10% tariff on imports from the world’s No. 2 economy.】

item.title: 美国铝业敦促特朗普豁免加拿大关税
item.description: 美国铝业呼吁唐纳德-特朗普总统将加拿大进口的金属原材料从其计划的关税中豁免，以帮助保护就业和国内制造商。【原文：The US aluminum industry called on President Donald Trump to exempt Canadian imports of the raw metal from his planned tariffs to help protect jobs and domestic manufacturers.】

item.title: 特朗普新关税计划的目标是什么？
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统在竞选期间曾承诺在其第二任总统任期内将进口税重新置于美国经济政策的中心位置。特朗普签署命令，对从加拿大和墨西哥进口的商品征收 25% 的全面关税，对从中国进口的商品征收 10% 的全面关税。关税将于 2 月 4 日星期二上午 12:01 开始生效。【原文：After promising during his election campaign to put import taxes back at the center of US economic policy during his second term as president, President Donald Trump took a dramatic step in that direction on Feb. 1. Trump signed orders imposing across-the-board tariffs of 25% on imports from Canada and Mexico and 10% from China. The tariffs will take effect at 12:01 am on Tuesday, Feb. 4.】

item.title: 彻底背叛"：特朗普关税冲击主要贸易关系，加拿大深感不安
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统签署行政命令，对美国从加拿大进口的几乎所有商品征收 25% 的关税，并对能源征收 10% 的关税后，加拿大做好了经济动荡的准备，并开始采取报复性贸易措施。【原文：Canada braced for economic turmoil and began rolling out retaliatory trade measures after President Donald Trump signed an executive order imposing 25% tariffs on almost everything the US imports from the country, and 10% on energy.】

item.title: 加藤称日本将密切关注特朗普关税对日元的影响
item.description: 日本财务大臣加藤胜信（Katsunobu Kato）表示，日本打算密切关注美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的新关税对日本货币的影响，并对贸易征税的国际影响感到担忧。【原文：Japan intends to closely monitor the impact on its currency of US President Donald Trump’s new tariffs and is worried about the international fallout from the trade imposts, Finance Minister Katsunobu Kato said.】

item.title: 墨西哥承诺对美国征收关税，同时呼吁与美国合作
item.description: 墨西哥总统克劳迪娅-谢因鲍姆表示，她已指示经济部长启动一项应对计划，其中包括对美国承诺的 25% 征税征收报复性关税。【原文：Mexico’s President Claudia Sheinbaum said she instructed the economy minister to kick off a response plan that includes retaliatory tariffs against the US’s promised 25% levies.】

item.title: 墨西哥总统提名何塞-夸德拉-加西亚为 Banxico 董事会成员
item.description: 根据彭博新闻社看到的一份文件，墨西哥总统克劳迪娅-希恩鲍姆提名何塞-加布里埃尔-夸德拉-加西亚（Jose Gabriel Cuadra Garcia）为央行五人董事会成员。【原文：Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum nominated Jose Gabriel Cuadra Garcia to the central bank’s five-member board, according to a document seen by Bloomberg News.】

item.title: 特朗普关税威胁扰乱石油市场，抬高美国油泵价格
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对加拿大和墨西哥进口商品征收关税，有可能扰乱北美紧密结合的石油市场，并推高美国驾车者的汽油价格。【原文：US President Donald Trump’s tariffs on Canadian and Mexican imports threaten to disrupt North America’s tightly integrated oil market and push up gasoline prices for American motorists.】

item.title: 特朗普在贸易战中对中国、加拿大和墨西哥征收关税
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统打响了关税战的第一枪，对加拿大和墨西哥普遍征收 25%的关税，对中国征收 10%的关税。【原文：President Donald Trump unleashed the first salvo of his tariff war, with general levies of 25% on Canada and Mexico and 10% on China — the start of a wave of promised trade barrages against foreign allies and adversaries alike.】

item.title: 特朗普签署对加拿大和墨西哥征收 25%、对中国征收 10%关税的协议
item.description: 据一位美国官员称，美国将对加拿大和墨西哥的出口商品征收 25% 的关税，并对中国商品征收 10% 的关税。【原文：The US will put 25% tariffs on exports from Canada and Mexico, as well as a 10% tariff on Chinese goods, according to a US official.】

item.title: 美国招聘保持稳健，重点放在修订上
item.description: 2025 年，美国劳动力市场可能又以一个月的稳健增长拉开了序幕，而备受期待的年度修正数据可能会显示，过去几年的招聘步伐明显更加温和。【原文：The US labor market probably kicked off 2025 with another month of solid growth, while highly anticipated annual revisions are likely to showcase a noticeably more moderate pace of hiring over the past few years.】

item.title: 银行家去世后，杰富瑞誓言支持并抨击网上毒液
item.description: 杰富瑞金融集团（Jefferies Financial Group Inc.首席执行官里奇-汉德勒（Rich Handler）在周末的一份备忘录中向初级银行家们保证，在一名 28 岁的投资银行家去世后，如果他们需要帮助，老板会给予支持。【原文：Jefferies Financial Group Inc. Chief Executive Officer Rich Handler assured junior bankers in a weekend memo that bosses will support them if they need help after the death of a 28-year-old investment banker.】

item.title: DeepSeek 之后，数据中心的欣喜开始退潮
item.description: DeepSeek 的聊天机器人在上周引发的市场动荡让一些人开始重新思考围绕人工智能的信贷狂潮。【原文：The market turmoil sparked by DeepSeek’s chatbot this past week has left some rethinking the credit frenzy around artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 据 Sole 报道，意大利联合信贷银行购买 Generali 4%至 5%的股份
item.description: 据《Il Sole 24 Ore》周六报道，意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit SpA）购买了 Assicurazioni Generali SpA 4%至 5%的股份，但未说明是如何获得这一信息的。【原文：UniCredit SpA has purchased a stake of between 4% to 5% in Assicurazioni Generali SpA, Il Sole 24 Ore reported on Saturday, without saying how it obtained the information.】

item.title: 加拿大准备报复特朗普关税，反思对美国的依赖
item.description: 加拿大将推出不断升级的报复性反关税，试图让美国人反对唐纳德-特朗普总统对加拿大商品征收25%的关税，这一威胁正促使加拿大重新思考其对南部邻国的依赖。【原文：Canada is set to introduce escalating retaliatory counter-tariffs to try to turn Americans against President Donald Trump’s 25% levies on Canadian goods, a threat that’s causing the country to rethink its dependence on its southern neighbor.】

item.title: 秘鲁 1 月通胀降温，仍在目标范围内
item.description: 秘鲁首都利马 1 月份的通货膨胀率与上月相比有所下降，但仍保持在中央银行的目标范围内。【原文：Inflation in Peru’s capital Lima cooled in January compared to the previous month, remaining within the central bank’s target range.】

item.title: 阿克曼称将在内华达州重新注册管理公司
item.description: "亿万富翁、对冲基金经理比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）在 X 上回复一个关于公司离开特拉华州的帖子时说："我们正在内华达州重新注册我们的管理公司。【原文：“We are reincorporating our management company in Nevada,” billionaire hedge fund manager Bill Ackman said on X in a reply to a post about companies leaving Delaware.】

item.title: 石油光辉褪去，埃克森和雪佛龙勇敢面对 DeepSeek 风险，追逐人工智能未来
item.description: 大石油公司曾经是硅谷轻资产、高增长世界的对立面。现在，它正寻求大科技的帮助，以保持其相关性。【原文：Big Oil was once the antithesis of the asset-light, hyper-growth world of Silicon Valley. Now it’s looking to Big Tech to stay relevant.】

item.title: 特朗普将在其新关税战中发起众多炮火中的第一炮
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统正在发动关税战的第一炮，并迫不及待地预演下一炮。【原文：President Donald Trump is unleashing the first salvo of his tariff war and can hardly wait to preview the next barrage.】

item.description:
美联储为何坚持 2% 的通胀目标？【原文：

item.title: 华丽七侠从 "岩石周 "中脱颖而出，毫不动摇
item.description: 对于美国最大的科技公司来说，这一周的开端是来自中国人工智能新贵的致命一击，包括一系列关键性的财报。【原文：After a week for the biggest US technology companies that began with a body blow from a Chinese AI upstart and included a batch of pivotal earnings, the biggest surprise may be how well they made it through.】

item.title: 印度推出基础设施债券信用增级系统
item.description: 印度周六宣布，计划为为开发公路、港口和桥梁等项目而出售的公司债券设立信用增级机制。【原文：India on Saturday announced plans to create a credit enhancement facility for corporate bonds sold to develop projects like roads, ports and bridges.】

item.title: 印度削减进口关税以促进本地制造业和出口
item.description: 印度将削减从电子产品到纺织品等一系列产品的关税，以促进当地制造业发展并创造就业机会。【原文：India will cut tariffs on a slew of products in sectors ranging from electronics to textile, in an attempt to boost local manufacturing and create jobs.】

item.title: 特朗普应对美元 "困境 "的选择
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）重新掌权后，美元多头蠢蠢欲动，这是有道理的。每当他或他的副手们宣布即将加征关税时（也许就在今天），美元兑墨西哥比索和加元等货币就会大涨。但所有这些威胁都在加剧货币市场的基本困境，特朗普的一位潜在顾问最近强调了这一点。【原文：US President Donald Trump’s return to power has fired up dollar bulls—and for good reason. The greenback surges against the likes of the Mexican peso and Canadian dollar whenever he or his lieutenants proclaim tariff hikes are in the offing (perhaps as soon as today). But all of those threats are worsening a fundamental dilemma in the currency market, one recently highlighted by one of Trump’s potential incoming advisers.】

item.title: 印度延长 GIFT 城市税收减免政策以吸引新投资
item.description: 印度政府宣布了一系列新措施，以促进对古吉拉特邦国际金融科技城（GIFT City）的投资，该城是印度金融市场自由化的试验。【原文：India’s government announced a fresh set of measures to boost investments in the Gujarat International Finance Tec-City, or GIFT City, India’s experiment to liberalize its financial markets.】

item.title: 经济学家称印度预算大胆，是亟需的 "财政奇才
item.description: 据经济学家称，印度财政部长在促进消费和缩小财政赤字之间走钢丝，因为政府正试图让放缓的经济重回正轨。【原文：India’s finance minister walked the tightrope between boosting consumption and narrowing the fiscal deficit as the government attempts to bring a slowing economy back on track, according to economists.】

item.title: 伊斯坦布尔消费者价格指数一月份上涨 5.16
item.description: 伊斯坦布尔 1 月份的消费者价格指数月率上升了 5.16%，预示着土耳其将在下周一公布全国月度通胀数据。【原文：The consumer price index for Istanbul rose 5.16% on a monthly basis in January, pointing to a tick up for Turkey’s national month-on-month inflation figure that’s due Monday.】
